subject: CLCV
name: Olympic Games
info: Surveys the Olympic Games (776 B.C. to A.D. 338) and other ancient athletic festivals, including those for women participants. Greek art and literature serve as basic sources.  Comparisons are made with modern athletic events.

subject: CLCV
name: Art of Islam
info: Architecture, painting, and other arts, from Islam's origins to 20th century. Cultural/political settings. Themes that unify diverse artistic styles of Islamic art.

subject: CLCV
name: Classical Epic
info: Homer's Iliad and Odyssey, Virgil's Aeneid. Cultural context of epic. Development of the hero. Epic style. Poetics of epic.

subject: CLCV
name: Olympic Games
info: The Olympic Games (776 B.C. to A.D. 338) and other ancient athletic festivals, including those for women participants. Greek art and literature serve as basic sources. Comparisons are made with modern athletic events.

subject: CLCV
name: Arch Practicum
fullname: Practicum in Archaeological Field and Computer Techniques
info: Methods used for excavation of Old and New World sites. Meets at archaeometry/computer lab for part of the semester and at a selectedsite in Minnesota for day-long sessions for 9 to 10 weeks.

subject: CLCV
name: Scandinavian Myths
info: Literary/cultural investigation of popular beliefs, myths, and religion of medieval Scandinavians. Interaction of paganism and Christianity. Reflection of myths in Old Scandinavian literature/art. All readings in English.

subject: CLCV
name: Great Books
info: Intensive study of major works of classical antiquity and later (written in or translated into English), related by kind, theme, style, or perspective. Sometimes including works from non-Western cultures.

subject: CLCV
name: Classics of LitCrit
info: Principles of criticism as expounded and employed in major critical works by writers such as Plato, Aristotle, Horace, Longinus, Sir Philip Sidney, John Dryden, Samuel Johnson, David Hume, William Wordsworth, Samuel Taylor Coleridge, and T. S. Eliotprereq: 1 course in literature, 2nd course in literature or philosophy or instr consent

subject: CLCV
name: Prosem Clas Trad
fullname: Proseminar: Classical Traditions in Western Culture
info: The nature of Greco-Roman classical traditions manifested in various cultural spheres: language and literature, fine arts, history, science, philosophy, theology, and other disciplines; the political, social, educational, and religious life of society. The perspective, scope, breadth, and depth of the course will vary.

subject: CLCV
name: Topics in Clas Civ
info: Topics specified in the Class Schedule.

subject: CLCV
name: Directed Studies
info: Directed Studies in Classical Civilizationprereq: instr consent

subject: CLCV
name: Directed Instruction
info: Directed Instruction in Classical Civilizationprereq: instr consent

subject: CLCV
name: Field Research in Archaeology
info: Field excavation, survey, and research at archaeological sites in Minnesota. Techniques of excavation/exploration. Interpretation of archaeological materials.
